comments.commentBody: My wife and I went to Iceland in Jan. 2010 for a week and loved it.  We highly recommend a pony ride -- many stables near Reykjavik offer rides even in the winter, and it was spectacular.  The stables have arctic thermal suits for your use on the ride.  We don't know how to ride at all, but the ponies are so stable and friendly that it wasn't a problem.  We also highly recommend the national art museum in Reykjavik -- we have two prints of Icelandic artists from the art museum hanging in our living room today.  And the Pingvellir (Ping Valley) is enchanting.  Final note -- we are gay travelers and felt completely at ease in Iceland -- we visited the gay community center and felt that they had a great community.

A remarkable man - remarkable drive - acceptance of criticism of his actions - has been criticised by Dalits and acceptance of his being as one of the masses a little man as when he said to the customs officer on leaving France to England to seek audience with the King - I have a sappath(shoe) , dhotis(shawls) in my baggage and you can see me as a 'simple soul' (or one of the humans on this planet) something to that effect. He was also criticised by his close friend Rabindranath Tagore for stating that a natural disaster in ?Behar was God's 'revenge' on the upper class for their  treatment of Dalits. Finally what are the lessons  from this man and their application in modern times?

The other report states that there are 187 million students in India between grades 1 and 8. The national government will provide $2 billion over the next three years to improve public schools, Without even including high school, that's $3.56 per year per child. Obviously, this new policy will fix the education system of India completely, for all time. Words cannot express the incompetence of Indian governance.

Will Ferguson's photographs of the tailors spur the Government or a philanthropist to make sure the men earn a decent wage? Will someone provide better lighting, a back rest for the bench, cool air(..it must be fetid and sweaty in that room), create a pleasant decor instead of rags pinned to windows?
One is moved to tears to think that those pieces of fabric sewn in such a depressing room will be worn by strutting models on catwalks around the world while fashion designers and middle management make off with tons of money.

Ferguson's pictures will be validated only when we stop preening ourselves with fancy words like:"dignity". and try to change the harsh reality of the Dharavi world.

it is true. affecting the system of education. poor re hard pressed to pay so much fees to schools. Low cost schools need volunteer teachers that is not there in India unlike USA.
If volunteer teachers really come forward may be retired teachers or other well educated retirees that may beef up education for children. in fact poor children really study hard while well to do children are attracted to several distractions and some kind of behavior that may be not needed for children at that age at all but parents help them that kind of distraction.
Future of any nation is built on the poor and bringing up of poor's children.
If real attention is given poor only really contribute for country's development. Well to do do not bother about the country as these well to do are some kind of attraction searchers. Unfortunately nations have not realized in the last 2 or 3 decades.
Problems will be there.
Truth is resources are scarce and to be prudently used. In the name of economic development some terribly waste resources and most do not have even minimum requirements.
Earlier governments realize their follies the better. Else it will lead to some serious conflicts if not properly administered the things in a most sensible and prudent ways.

Education is about drawing knowledge in a properly cadenced way. Else rhythm is lost.
Education is to be administered in proper doses like medicine for proper healthy development of knowledge.
Misused education is going to become dangerous to very dangerous,
Terrorism is on account of poverty and misuse of resources by a few.
Earlier to terrorism communism was there that contained all terrorist tendencies.
People feared communism but unwittingly allowed terrorism to swing upwards,
Mild terror is developed for a good cause warning something is going wrong in administering,
Let us go back further.
When education as such was devised, the purpose was to sequence the mind to duly mend the society to live in a peaceful way that was the essential spirit behind.
In India, even Lord Ram a king Dasseratha's son as a prince has to go to gurukula a school where the prince is mixing with different tiers of society as also he has to walk into forests to look after the welfare of tribals and look after their essential needs are met like pure drinking water by making rivers have unpolluted water, forests are not destroyed indiscriminately and the like and kind of knowledge sprinkled by teachers who thus had influence on the kings. So also they are ordained frugal living habits so that they are made foolproof of difficulties - like Alfred the Great in England to carry on in very difficult circumstance.
So it evolves from cognitive psychology.
so it is a very big story sirs. tq
Yes for Holloween.  It's 12:25am 2012 GMT and a Happy New Year to you too.
Deadline has the right answer, MOL.  Basically , just a light water proof jacket.

I never managed to finish the puzzle, although my house guest did.  I worked all day on a wine quiz - trying to win a trip to Cognac.  I now have 29 out of 30 questions.  House guest & friendand I have had a nice New Year Eve & I'm now ready for bed, having stayed up long enough to see the fab fire works in London.  Happy New Year everyone.

Nina,I think I should retire with my record still intact...

Rich, Sarasota's pretty damn nice - especially compared with the last couple of winters in the Northeast. Can't wait!
I think it will be a woman because there have been so many men lately and I'll tale my chances with Paula Gamache.
Good guess, John, considering the puzzle was published online an hour and 48 minutes ahead of the comment...

Ha! Patrick indeed! Better watch out, I'm close to being unbearably smug. Are you impressed, Nina?

It was a, um, fun puzzle to kick off the New Year, and I loved all 10 of the theme answers.

Starting to pack for Florida - leaving in 8 days...
LOL John and Deb!

I've always been baffled by superhero costumes, but I guess that's because I never made the connection between peace and exterior underpants. Live and learn....

Seriously, it was a super puzzle, EC and HR. Thanks!

This 'crostic? No pushover do,
Superheroes? A low level crew!
To this day we're averse
To these beings diverse,
It's a mind-numbing dull déja vu!

To be honest I am less concerned about multiple divorces than the two Mormon candidates thinking it is somehow spiritual advantageous to wear special underwear. I would love to see that question asked of Romney and hear the answer he gives. Talk about strange!

The problem is not Newt's divorces, but his moral hypocrisy. Trump may be be on his third marriage, but at least he is not a moral hypocrite about them.
In fact, he has spoken quite candidly about them, has maintained good relationships with his ex wives who ended up quite wel offl financially. He also seems to be a pretty good father to his kids, Newt's gay daughter on the other hand, said publicly that she will not vote for him. The idea of a Trump presidency is a joke, but not because of his multiple marriages.

Divorce in and of itself should not be a reflection of a person's character,especially if they are wealthy enough to terminate unhappy relationships fairly and generously. Is it good to subject kids to an unhealthy, loveless, tension filled marriage?

Three thousand years ago, Spartan women could divorce their husbands by going to the public square and making a declaration terminating the union. Their husbands, by the way, the legendary Spartan warriors who defeated the great Persian army with 300 men, were all bisexual
.
Take that you two stupid Ricks. I mean Santurum and Perry!.

Martin Stein,

Having multiple divorces and marriages is moral hypocrisy.

Read the marriage vows.
Funny how the "Catholic" candidate has had more wives than the two Mormon candidates put together...

Well, tonight is New year's Eve and I'm done with the puzzle and wondering what ever happened to Guy Lombardo playing at the Roosevelt Hotel in New Orleans.

Nice way to start the new year with a PB puzzle.

What is a smooth puzzle that glows on the screen? A Patrick Barium.

fivethirtyam, Well, Good Day, Dear Lady, and here's that "hidden" comment your Dial-Up can't reveal that was posted at around 10 a.m. albeit not in exactly the same wording, as others in WP will detect, provided they're of a mind to read them both?
It's of considerable length, btw, which is normally not my style.
So I trust after typing it a second time, you'll appreciate my going the extra yard for you, as I feel you're certainly well worth it.
It began thusly: Before I commence to comment on your post, may I wish you and yours a Happy, Healthy and prosperous New Year...Yours truly is very thankful to wish anyone the same, especially in light of the fact I experienced a slightly scary event in late Sept. that set me back for 6 wks. or so.
Getting back to your comment, we must say your talent for predicting the future is quite uncanny, not only your Gorski call on Christmas Day, but for King Krozel's appearance today!
Oh, and btw, who ever said you were old...judging by the pic on MOL's blog, I, for one, has to markedly disagree. So, tell us, fivethirty, what's in store for us manana, besides a nice box of dark chocolates (the darker, the better for one) or so I hear tell?
Oh, and (lastly?) Jeanne Nixon, the 2nd, will we ALL be here on Planet Earth, this time next year to ring in Jan. one, 2013???
Curious minds REALLY need to know this!

Howie

I used to have a good HEAD OF HAREM until I started doing crossword puzzles. Now there isn't much left to be SHORN...Who knew Don Quixote's real name was ALONSO? The man of La Mancha, aka Lon Quijano... As I watch 2011 DEPART and become yet another year OF YORE, I welcome twenty-TWELVE. Here's a toast of MUMM to you...And a second salute to our esteemed HOSTESS, Deb, truly the SEOUL of the blog. You made it look easy and probably didn't even BREAK a sweat...And here's one for you too Will for all the X-ING OUT you did this year. There's NOAH better editor in the biz... A clink of the glasses also to Patrick Berry whose entries are never a BUMMER. The week long contest was sono BUONO... Last but certainly not least, here's to all the commenters. A TIP of the CAP to you. You have enlightened me countless times this year and I thank you for that... Here's wishing health and happiness to OUR entire NYT WP network. Peace.

Hi, John,

By now it should be obvious that you only embarrassed yourself calling out Deb for that clip. Next time you should be more sensitive in your comment. Personally I like the clip and see nothing wrong with it. Lauren was merely giving Boggie a lesson on how to whistle if he needed her. You just put your lips together and...blow....
Table for two?
Deb - That movie clip tells me that whatever else you are, you are a naughty girl....
It took me longer than usual to get a start on this one--probably because I misspent my early years reading ... well ... books--but then a more than enjoyable outing.

No comments yet? Wow!

Enjoyed the puzzle, but fell apart where Jimi Hendrix (3D) met Steely Dan (26A).

The Police --- a rock band featuring Sting --- Roxanne virtually their signature song.
Thx HEX! Good one!
Good luck!

For the first time in our marriage my wife, Surang, and I decided to let New Year's Eve pass unsung. We went out for a nice Thai meal, came home to enjoy a quiet evening together, and if we're still awake at midnight we'll toast the change of dates with a snifter of Bailey's Irish Cream before toddling off to bed.

All this is by way of explaining why I had time to do the Sunday puzzle tonight. And it was a treat. The theme entries were witty, entertaining, and plentiful. There were a fair number of chances for apt but incorrect answers: I tried BLT at 10A, LID at 42A, BLOT at 54A (and therefore TILTED at 55D), CONKED then BONKED at 104A, ERR at 4D, LEARN at 20D, TRASHY at 97D, and FOG at 111D (kind of dumb, that last one).

In spite of all those missteps, I was able to solve my way through the puzzle and earn an unassisted MHP, my fourth in a row to round out a gratifying New Year's weekend. I'm looking forward to trying to extend my winning streak on Sunday at the casino at Harrington Raceway, in Delaware.

Best wishes to all my fellow blog commenters for a great new year.

Maybe:

"She made me drag her through all this."

Karen Garcia... Perfectly stated!

The members of Congress and the Senate who voted for this Bill (along with the President) are now officially treasonous criminals.

Time to clean house. The Right-Left Paradigm is a fraud and a hoax.

They have ALL (ok... maybe 5 of them haven't) sold us out to the Corporations/Military Industrial Complex/Banksters/Wall Street Hooligans.

Get the money out of elections. Until we do, all politicians are for sale.

Wake up, America...

AND he should be remembered as the constitutional lawyer who signed indefinite detention without charge or trial in law.

Someone who should know better is doing a lot of lasting and permanent damage.

And I agree with everthing else you have written, Karen.

One small stroke of a unitary executive pen, one giant leap backward for democracy. ACLU Director Anthony Romero calls this craven act the moment when Barack Obama gained the dubious distinction of becoming "forever remembered as the president who signed indefinite detention without charge or trial into law."

Obama's accompanying signing statement is disingenuous at best, cynical at worst. It was a cowardly New Year's Eve news dump, We are told to trust him unquestioningly because he is the good guy, the Democrat, who would never go against the Constitution and deny an American citizen due process. If he has thought at all about possible dangerous successors waiting in the wings to broaden the scope of this dangerous and muddy bill to accusing and "disappearing" peaceful domestic protesters, it was not enough to make him veto it. This should scare us all to death.

We finally know why the president chose not to prosecute the Bush war criminals. He shares many if not most of the same neocon values and is using the same fear factor to keep the populace cowed, "secure" and stripped of their basic rights.

And this is the man who dares ask us to help him fight a recalcitrant Congress? When it comes to enabling the Security State and the Military Industrial Complex, the two warring political factions never fail to jump into each other's arms to call a complicit truce.

One more reason to Occupy, as if we needed another reason.

Out of curiosity, does anyone know know what the longest call options on SIRI were trading at on June 30, 2009 when Mel Karmazin, chief executive of Sirius XM Radio, was granted options to buy the company stock at 43 cents a share?

I hope the company was required to value the calls for no less than the actual market price, no matter what "model" they used.
